title: text face w/ matrix script bold headlines
content: I'm in bit of a conundrum over a project due tomorrow morning, and my usual procrastination adrenaline isn't giving me any good ideas. Any suggestions for what text face would look good with Matrix Script Bold as the headline font? Thanks!
author: FeeltheKern

comments.content: You read my mind, Dav, I was gonna suggest the same.

Yes, but do sub in Kris's actually-usable "g" from here:  
 [http://typophile.com/node/14378](http://web.archive.org/web/20110524040544/http:/typophile.com/node/14378 "http://typophile.com/node/14378")

hhp

I think the real challenge is to find an Emigre font that doesn't have at least one character you want to redesign! No offense to anybody but try the "a" in Priori, the "k" in Dalliance, the list goes on and on. It's so frustrating.
Oooh. I love the \_k\_ in Dalliance.
Actually, I think Eidectic Neo would work with Matrix Script.

Patricia, Stephen once said [almost] exactly the same thing:  
 [http://www.typophile.com/node/14346](http://web.archive.org/web/20110524040544/http:/www.typophile.com/node/14346 "http://www.typophile.com/node/14346")

To me, Eidetic was actually Emigre's first (and still only?) real text font.

hhp

Nah. I disagree, Hrant. If you think Eidetic works as text then Tribute qualifies as a text font. Vendetta too. Fairplex might. Mrs. Eaves sorta. Eidetic has some characters that really leave me cold. I would only use it as a display font.

[Edit: Generally, Eidetic isn't my cup of tea. That's all.]

I think Filosofia is a great text font. Mrs. Eaves would but it's too wide for most uses. I'm not nuts about Eidetic either, but I like Tribute. Somehow the poopy glyphs work for me there.

Try getting a client to go for the "k" in Dalliance

I don't love Eidetic. But I try to put my personal tastes  
aside when it comes to judging if a font is texty or not.

Tribute: I agree, it's a text face. Note that I put a  
question mark after "still only" - basically because I  
haven't been following Emigre recently. I remember  
when Eidetic came out I thought it was their first real  
text face - so I stand by that. Tribute's "g" was suspect  
to me when I first saw it, but then I saw the issue of  
the magazine where it was used, and realized it's fine.  
So I'm sorry, I forgot to remember Tribute.

Vendetta: Out of context I agree that it <cite>can</cite> be a  
text face. But it has a "fatal" problem in that respect:  
its central feature -the facetness- can only really click  
with optical masters. Lacking optical masters, that feature  
basically kills it as a well-rounded text font: if you set it  
at more than one size, it becomes more than one face.  
Excoffon knew this, which is why -even with the  
availability of the pantograph- he decided to make  
Mistral's roughness inversely proportional to size.

The others: no.

hhp

I have tried to use Vendetta for text and always end up using something else instead.

Hrant, why not Filosofia? Just curious...

Edit: I should add that I'd use Eidetic in a heartbeat over Fairplex. They struck out with that one in my book.

Filosofia is a Didone, and its high contrast coupled with  
the vertical axis and the high regularity put it outside  
what I class as a text face. With some ink bleed at small  
sizes it would have a better chance, but its proportions  
are too dainty for small text.

hhp

Fairplex was a bad suggestion. It is more a display/headline/advertising text font. Filosofia is a Didone, but a very warm and warn one. Again, though, not completely well suited for reading. I once saw a cookbook done with Vendetta and it was lovely. I think Vendetta might be a tad thin, but if you use the Medium weight and can afford a larger point size it is nice.

\> if you use the Medium weight and can afford a larger point size it is nice.

In fact Vendetta's vertical proportions are quite refreshing that way.

hhp
